column4: every time this has happend and I don't want to do this again..
i have to reinstall
It keeps freezing at Calculating module dependencies...
ahhhhhhhhh
ahh
It keeps freezing at Calculating module dependencies
ahhhhhhh
HELLP
are you trying to add something or just update?
I'm just trying to boot
you mean this happened during initial install of ubuntu?
no, I've had ubuntu running fabulous for half a year...
lol  thats what i asked you   did you add someting or upgrade
does it boot using recovery
how do i use recovery?
grub menu
I don't have a grub menu, It's ppc
have you added or removed any hardware lately?
no... theres not really anything to install on an ibook
is /home on its own partition?
no
you could always use a liveCD to copy off your /home settings
huh?   it wont boot either?
what?
sorry  ::P
the LiveCDs dont work either
does fdisk -l   show any partitions?
the livecd doesn't have the fdisk command
what directory are you trying to mount it to?
do you have ANY other liveCDs  say knoppix?
no I don't...
my vote goes for having a friend burn you  2 diff liveCDs   say 1-ubuntu and 1-knoppix    then  have a go  before the reinstall wipes it
I have a cd burner
at least I have my main ubuntu computer, this one.  But my iBook is important whenever I have to go places
yes  i keep both
which do you think I should use first?
whats broken?
my iBook..
zero experience with apple products   wich i did
I did a dist-upgrade from breezy to breezy and it got rid of a kernel module or something, then had some hard drive errors on some modules
and it won't boot at all past calculating module dependencies
should I use knoppix ?
sure
but i think Ubuntu liveCD should be your first choice
alright, but that corrupted on me randomly a lot...
I wanna try something new anyways... = p  I'll be able to make changes to my hard drive right?  Will I be able to use apt on the hard drive to make changes?
ohhh i remember you    is this a new problem or same one?
yea it's me,  It's that same problem
i thought we left you with a plan of attack last night
im not at home yet  so i cant check my log
ahh, does knoppix have a ppc version??
i thought there was one
I'm not seeing one, but the ubuntu live cd and its brownness distracts me = p
all i found was a 2year old ppc version of knoppix     the Gentoo PPC LiveCD  is also an option
alright, I'll just go with ubuntu live
im still at work  sorry for the delay with replies
It's alright! = )
what do you do for work?
network admin
That's cool, is it fun?
as long as the servers dont catch on fire i mess with "tech toys" all day
= p
easy big fella
lol, I'm confused what to do..
i have to run a min to check on my users,  but   are you doing a fresh install?
do you know what ubuntu is doing when it is calculating module dependencies at boot?

It freezes at calculating module dependencies every time after that
your a network admin right? lol
yes
yay.  But do you have any idea what to do to fix my ibook?
nothing about ibooks :(
too busy playing with Linux
well I'm trying to fix the calculating module dependencies thing
do I chroot to the harddrive with the livecd, and then what?
im not a chroot pro  only used it a few times
ok, well how do i fix the module dependencies thing? lolol
im re-reading your post
it boots to grub right    have you tried a recovery kernel
your old ones
they don't put a recover kernel with the ppc version, anyways, I got the livecd up and my hard drive mounted, I have access to all the files on my harddrive
also you can "append"  some commends to your grub boot   to disable all the fancy stuff like acpi   so you can at least boot to fix it
i dont have a clue  what would help an ibook boot
ok but I'm booted into the livecd and I can make the changes there, I just don't know what to fix...
on an ibm lappy i would try disabling acpi and apic
reinstall the kernel  wold be a start
ok, should I use apt?
